content.title: Incentive For The Sc Widow Remarriage
content.beneficiary: Widows belonging to the SC Community
content.details: This scheme is aimed at encouraging widows to remarry by providing financial assistance to lead a normal life. The main objective of the scheme is to promote widow remarriage and rehabilitate widows by providing financial assistance. This scheme brings in a new dimension of social change among the widows. Under this scheme, the Social Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka will give incentives to the remarried widows belonging to the SC Community. The incentive amount is ₹ 3 Lakh. The incentive is provided only to those who have submitted applications within 1 year of marriage. There is no annual income limit for this scheme. The widow should belong to SC Community. Spouses can belong to any Caste/Religion.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹ 3 Lakh for remarried widows belonging to SC Community
eligibility: Applicant should be a resident of Karnataka state.
Applicant should belong to the SC community.
There is no annual income limit for this scheme.
The scheme is applicable within 1 year of marriage.
Widow should belong to SC Community.
documents_required: Any address proof of the previous spouse

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows of SC community belonging to Karnataka State can get the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits that a person gets under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the Social Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka will give an incentive of ₹3 lakh to the remarried widows belonging to SC Community.

faqs.question: Is the benefit limited to only persons belonging to SC Community?
faqs.answer: Yes, the benefit of this scheme is limited To The Married Widows Belonging To SC Community. The Spouse May Belong To Any Community.

faqs.question: Are Inter-Caste Married Couples eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, inter-caste married couples are eligible for this scheme as long as the widow woman belongs to Scheduled Caste.

faqs.question: Is there a time limit to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the couple must apply for this scheme within one year of marriage.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the income of family to avail this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no limit of income to be eligible for availing benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Can this scheme be applied online?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for this scheme is to be done online.

faqs.question: Which documents are required for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar Card, RD Number of Caste Certificate, Present Marriage Registration Certificate, Copy of the Bank Passbook, Date of Birth Proof, Marriage Photo, Mobile Number, Previous Spouse's Death Certificate, and Any address proof of the previous spouse.

faqs.question: From where can I get the caste and marriage certificates?
faqs.answer: Both Caste and Marriage certificates can be applied online.

faqs.question: Which document can be used for Permanent Residence Proof?
faqs.answer: You can use Aadhaar as permanent Address Proof.
